awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Numerical Analysis of                Three-Dimensional Inviscid Flows with Multiple Shocks
awd_abstract_narration: The principal investigator will study how the so-called                    "lambda-scheme" for integrating Euler's equations can be extended               from two-dimensional problems to three-dimensional problems.                    This technique will be complemented by a three-dimensional                      extension of shock-fitting methods.                                                  Both the lambda-scheme and the shock-fitting methods have                  proved to be efficient, accurate and reliable in a variety of                   two-dimensional problems.  Internal and external flow problems                  will be analyzed in the course of the research.  This will                      require the study of novel types of grids, generated by conformal               mapping, which are interesting on their own rights.  Evaluation                 of the accuracy of the numerical technique by comparison with                   exact solutions will be made, whenever possible.  Particular                    emphasis will be given to the numerical interpretation of the                   physics of shock interactions.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
